result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron James Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *3/24/2016 Honorable John Siefert-Modification of Sentence, count one: Sentence is withheld placed on probation for two (2) years.

miscConds.notes: *3/24/2016  Defendant ordered to comply with methadone treatment and any and all rules of probation established by the probation agent.

timeConds.notes: *3/24/2016  STAYED to be imposed at agent's discretion.

supervisions.notes:
***06-10-2016/Honorable John Siefert
On March 24, 2016 the court modified the sentence on count one by withholding sentence and placing the defendant on probation for two years. On March 1, 2016, the court withheld sentence on count two and placed the defendant on probation for two years to be served consecutive to count 1. The modification has resulted in consecutive terms of probation, which is not authorized by law. The judgment shall be amended to state that the probation term on count two is concurrent with count one.***

Defendant ordered sentence withheld and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years consecutive to Count 1.
Both sentences are consecutive to any other sentence.  There are no credit days.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $549.93 to be paid to Target Store, to be paid during the term of probation to convert to a civil judgment.

Maintain his driver license.
Random UAs.
Follow rules of the Probation Department.
Court waived all court costs due to defendant's inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron James Sanders

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court signed order amending judgment of conviction to reflect that the Probation in Count TWO is concurrent to the probation in Count ONE. Copies sent to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probation term on count two.

Court grants defense motion to modify count ONE AND AMEND THE JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION TO REFLECT THE FOLLOWING:   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for  ZERO DAYS  time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS with the following conditions:
*FIVE MONTHS CONDITION TIME , STATEYED AND TO BE IMPOSED AT THE PROBVATION AGENT'S DISCRETION, AND THE COURT FURTHER ORDERS THAT THE DEFENDANT COMPLY WITH METHADONE TREATMENT AND ANY AND ALL RULES OF PROBATION ESTABLISHED BY THE PROBATION AGENT.

Defendant Aaron James Sanders in court with attorney Reyna Morales for Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts 1 & 2:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  As to Counts 3 & 4:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed.and read in.
Sentencing statements heard from the state, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 5 months in the House of Correction to be served on electronic monitoring, and with Huber Privileges for work and methadone treatment.  Report date is stayed to 3/21/2016 at 5:00 pm.
As to Count 2:  Defendant ordered sentence withheld and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years consecutive to Count 1.
Both sentences are consecutive to any other sentence.  There are no credit days.
Condition of probation on Count 2 are as follows:
- Restitution of $549.93 to be paid to Target Store, to be paid during the term of probation to convert to a civil judgment
- maintain his driver license
- seek and maintain employment
- random UAs
- follow rules of the Probation Department.
Court waived all court costs due to defendant's inability to pay.
Appeal rights given.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form and documents in support of the defendant, received and filed.

Defendant Aaron James Sanders in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 47  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron James Sanders in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for FINAL PRETRIAL ON 2-22-16 AT 8:30 AND  jury trial in Branch 47  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aaron James Sanders in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY; and attend all court scheduled court appearances.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Target located at 1501 Miller Park Way, in the Village of West Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

Defendant Aaron James Sanders in court.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 8/3/15 @ 1:30 pm
